member.name: N:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server
member.summary: The namespace contains classes, interfaces, and enumerations that are specific to the integration of the Microsoft .NET Framework common language runtime (CLR) into Microsoft SQL Server, and the SQL Server database engine process execution environment.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.DataAccessKind
member.summary: Describes the type of access to user data for a user-defined method or function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.DataAccessKind.None
member.summary: The method or function does not access user data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.DataAccessKind.Read
member.summary: The method or function reads user data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.Format
member.summary: Used by and to indicate the serialization format of a user-defined type (UDT) or aggregate.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.Format.Native
member.summary: The Native serialization format uses a very simple algorithm that enables SQL Server to store an efficient representation of the UDT on disk. Types marked for Native serialization can only have value types (structs in Microsoft Visual C#, and structures in Microsoft Visual Basic .NET) as members. Members of reference types (such as classes in Visual C# and Visual Basic), either user-defined or those existing in the framework (such as ), are not supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.Format.Unknown
member.summary: The serialization format is unknown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.Format.UserDefined
member.summary: The UserDefined serialization format gives the developer full control over the binary format through the .Write and .Read methods.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.IBinarySerialize
member.summary: Provides custom implementation for user-defined type (UDT) and user-defined aggregate serialization and deserialization.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.IBinarySerialize.Read(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Generates a user-defined type (UDT) or user-defined aggregate from its binary form.
member.param: The stream from which the object is deserialized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.IBinarySerialize.Write(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Converts a user-defined type (UDT) or user-defined aggregate into its binary format.
member.param: The stream to which the UDT or user-defined aggregate is serialized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.InvalidUdtException
member.summary: Thrown when SQL Server or the ADO.NET provider detects an invalid user-defined type (UDT).

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.InvalidUdtException.GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Streams all the properties into the class for the given .

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlContext
member.summary: Represents an abstraction of the caller's context, which provides access to the , , and objects. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlContext.IsAvailable
member.summary: Specifies whether the calling code is running within SQL Server, and if the context connection can be accessed.
member.returns: True if the context connection is available and the other members can be accessed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlContext.Pipe
member.summary: Gets the pipe object that allows the caller to send result sets, messages, and the results of executing commands back to the client.
member.returns: An instance of if a pipe is available, or null if called in a context where pipe is not available (for example, in a user-defined function).

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlContext.TriggerContext
member.summary: Gets the trigger context used to provide the caller with information about what caused the trigger to fire, and a map of the columns that were updated.
member.returns: An instance of if a trigger context is available, or null if called outside of a trigger invocation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlContext.WindowsIdentity
member.summary: The Microsoft Windows identity of the caller.
member.returns: A instance representing the Windows identity of the caller, or null if the client was authenticated using SQL Server Authentication.

member.returns: .None: Does not access data. .Read: Only reads user data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlFunctionAttribute.IsDeterministic

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlFunctionAttribute.IsPrecise
member.summary: Indicates whether the function involves imprecise computations, such as floating point operations.
member.returns: true if the function involves precise computations; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Server.SqlFunctionAttribute.SystemDataAccess
member.summary: Indicates whether the function requires access to data stored in the system catalogs or virtual system tables of SQL Server.
member.returns: .None: Does not access system data. .Read: Only reads system data.

member.name: N:System.Data

member.summary: Determines the action that occurs when the or method is invoked on a with a .

member.name: F:System.Data.AcceptRejectRule.Cascade
member.summary: Changes are cascaded across the relationship.

member.name: F:System.Data.AcceptRejectRule.None
member.summary: No action occurs (default).

member.name: T:System.Data.CommandBehavior
member.summary: Provides a description of the results of the query and its effect on the database.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandBehavior.CloseConnection
member.summary: When the command is executed, the associated Connection object is closed when the associated DataReader object is closed.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandBehavior.Default
member.summary: The query may return multiple result sets. Execution of the query may effect the database state. Default sets no flags, so calling ExecuteReader(CommandBehavior.Default) is functionally equivalent to calling ExecuteReader().

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandBehavior.KeyInfo
member.summary: The query returns column and primary key information.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandBehavior.SchemaOnly
member.summary: The query returns column information only. When using , the .NET Framework Data Provider for SQL Server precedes the statement being executed with SET FMTONLY ON.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandBehavior.SequentialAccess
member.summary: Provides a way for the DataReader to handle rows that contain columns with large binary values. Rather than loading the entire row, SequentialAccess enables the DataReader to load data as a stream. You can then use the GetBytes or GetChars method to specify a byte location to start the read operation, and a limited buffer size for the data being returned.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandBehavior.SingleResult
member.summary: The query returns a single result set.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandBehavior.SingleRow
member.summary: The query is expected to return a single row. Execution of the query may affect the database state. Some .NET Framework data providers may, but are not required to, use this information to optimize the performance of the command. When you specify with the method of the object, the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB performs binding using the OLE DB IRow interface if it is available. Otherwise, it uses the IRowset interface. If your SQL statement is expected to return only a single row, specifying can also improve application performance. It is possible to specify SingleRow when executing queries that return multiple result sets. In that case, multiple result sets are still returned, but each result set has a single row.

member.name: T:System.Data.CommandType
member.summary: Specifies how a command string is interpreted.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandType.StoredProcedure
member.summary: The name of a stored procedure.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandType.TableDirect
member.summary: The name of a table.

member.name: F:System.Data.CommandType.Text
member.summary: An SQL text command. (Default.)

member.name: T:System.Data.ConflictOption
member.summary: Specifies how conflicting changes to the data source will be detected and resolved.

member.name: F:System.Data.ConflictOption.CompareAllSearchableValues
member.summary: Update and delete statements will include all searchable columns from the table in the WHERE clause. This is equivalent to specifying CompareAllValuesUpdate | CompareAllValuesDelete.

member.name: F:System.Data.ConflictOption.CompareRowVersion
member.summary: If any Timestamp columns exist in the table, they are used in the WHERE clause for all generated update statements. This is equivalent to specifying CompareRowVersionUpdate | CompareRowVersionDelete.

member.name: F:System.Data.ConflictOption.OverwriteChanges
member.summary: All update and delete statements include only columns in the WHERE clause. If no is defined, all searchable columns are included in the WHERE clause. This is equivalent to OverwriteChangesUpdate | OverwriteChangesDelete.

member.name: T:System.Data.ConnectionState
member.summary: Describes the current state of the connection to a data source.

member.name: F:System.Data.ConnectionState.Broken
member.summary: The connection to the data source is broken. This can occur only after the connection has been opened. A connection in this state may be closed and then re-opened. (This value is reserved for future versions of the product.)

member.name: F:System.Data.ConnectionState.Closed
member.summary: The connection is closed.

member.name: F:System.Data.ConnectionState.Connecting
member.summary: The connection object is connecting to the data source. (This value is reserved for future versions of the product.)

member.name: F:System.Data.ConnectionState.Executing
member.summary: The connection object is executing a command. (This value is reserved for future versions of the product.)

member.name: F:System.Data.ConnectionState.Fetching
member.summary: The connection object is retrieving data. (This value is reserved for future versions of the product.)

member.name: F:System.Data.ConnectionState.Open
member.summary: The connection is open.

member.name: T:System.Data.DataSetDateTime
member.summary: Describes the serialization format for columns in a .

member.name: F:System.Data.DataSetDateTime.Local
member.summary: DateTime is always stored in Local. If or is assigned to a column in this mode, it is first converted into Local. Serialization in this mode is always performed in Local. There is an offset during serialization.

member.name: F:System.Data.DataSetDateTime.Unspecified
member.summary: DateTime is always stored in Unspecified. If or is assigned to a column in this mode, it is first converted into . Serialization in this mode does not cause an offset.

member.name: F:System.Data.DataSetDateTime.UnspecifiedLocal
member.summary: DateTime is stored in Unspecified. If or is assigned to a column in this mode, it is first converted into . Serialization in this mode causes offset. This is the default behavior and is backward compatible. This option should be thought of as being Unspecified in storage but applying an offset that is similar to during serialization.

member.name: F:System.Data.DataSetDateTime.Utc
member.summary: DateTime is stored in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). If or is assigned to a column in this mode, it is first converted into Utc format. Serialization in this mode is always performed in Utc. There is no offset during serialization.

member.name: T:System.Data.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the transaction locking behavior for the connection.

member.name: F:System.Data.IsolationLevel.Chaos
member.summary: The pending changes from more highly isolated transactions cannot be overwritten.

member.name: F:System.Data.IsolationLevel.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Shared locks are held while the data is being read to avoid dirty reads, but the data can be changed before the end of the transaction, resulting in non-repeatable reads or phantom data.

member.name: F:System.Data.IsolationLevel.ReadUncommitted
member.summary: A dirty read is possible, meaning that no shared locks are issued and no exclusive locks are honored.

member.name: F:System.Data.IsolationLevel.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Locks are placed on all data that is used in a query, preventing other users from updating the data. Prevents non-repeatable reads but phantom rows are still possible.

member.name: F:System.Data.IsolationLevel.Serializable
member.summary: A range lock is placed on the , preventing other users from updating or inserting rows into the dataset until the transaction is complete.

member.name: F:System.Data.IsolationLevel.Snapshot
member.summary: Reduces blocking by storing a version of data that one application can read while another is modifying the same data. Indicates that from one transaction you cannot see changes made in other transactions, even if you requery.

member.name: F:System.Data.IsolationLevel.Unspecified
member.summary: A different isolation level than the one specified is being used, but the level cannot be determined.

member.name: T:System.Data.MissingSchemaAction
member.summary: Specifies the action to take when adding data to the and the required or is missing.

member.name: F:System.Data.MissingSchemaAction.Add
member.summary: Adds the necessary columns to complete the schema.

member.name: F:System.Data.MissingSchemaAction.AddWithKey
member.summary: Adds the necessary columns and primary key information to complete the schema. For more information about how primary key information is added to a , see .To function properly with the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB, AddWithKey requires that the native OLE DB provider obtains necessary primary key information by setting the DBPROP_UNIQUEROWS property, and then determines which columns are primary key columns by examining DBCOLUMN_KEYCOLUMN in the IColumnsRowset. As an alternative, the user may explicitly set the primary key constraints on each . This ensures that incoming records that match existing records are updated instead of appended. When using AddWithKey, the .NET Framework Data Provider for SQL Server appends a FOR BROWSE clause to the statement being executed. The user should be aware of potential side effects, such as interference with the use of SET FMTONLY ON statements. See SQL Server Books Online for more information.

member.summary: . A 64-bit signed integer.

member.summary: of type . A fixed-length stream of binary data ranging between 1 and 8,000 bytes.

member.summary: . An unsigned numeric value that can be 0, 1, or null.

member.summary: . A fixed-length stream of non-Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 8,000 characters.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.Decimal
member.summary: . A fixed precision and scale numeric value between -10 38 -1 and 10 38 -1.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.Float
member.summary: . A floating point number within the range of -1.79E +308 through 1.79E +308.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.Image
member.summary: of type . A variable-length stream of binary data ranging from 0 to 2 31 -1 (or 2,147,483,647) bytes.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.Int
member.summary: . A 32-bit signed integer.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.Money
member.summary: . A currency value ranging from -2 63 (or -922,337,203,685,477.5808) to 2 63 -1 (or +922,337,203,685,477.5807) with an accuracy to a ten-thousandth of a currency unit.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.NChar
member.summary: . A fixed-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.NText
member.summary: . A variable-length stream of Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 30 - 1 (or 1,073,741,823) characters.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.NVarChar
member.summary: . A variable-length stream of Unicode characters ranging between 1 and 4,000 characters. Implicit conversion fails if the string is greater than 4,000 characters. Explicitly set the object when working with strings longer than 4,000 characters.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.Real
member.summary: . A floating point number within the range of -3.40E +38 through 3.40E +38.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.SmallDateTime

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.SmallInt
member.summary: . A 16-bit signed integer.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.SmallMoney
member.summary: . A currency value ranging from -214,748.3648 to +214,748.3647 with an accuracy to a ten-thousandth of a currency unit.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlDbType.Text
member.summary: . A variable-length stream of non-Unicode data with a maximum length of 2 31 -1 (or 2,147,483,647) characters.

member.name: T:System.Data.XmlReadMode
member.summary: Specifies how to read XML data and a relational schema into a .

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlReadMode.Auto
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlReadMode.DiffGram
member.summary: Reads a DiffGram, applying changes from the DiffGram to the . The semantics are identical to those of a operation. As with the operation, values are preserved. Input to with DiffGrams should only be obtained using the output from as a DiffGram.

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlReadMode.Fragment
member.summary: Reads XML fragments, such as those generated by executing FOR XML queries, against an instance of SQL Server. When is set to Fragment, the default namespace is read as the inline schema.

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlReadMode.IgnoreSchema
member.summary: Ignores any inline schema and reads data into the existing schema. If any data does not match the existing schema, it is discarded (including data from differing namespaces defined for the ). If the data is a DiffGram, IgnoreSchema has the same functionality as DiffGram.

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlReadMode.InferSchema
member.summary: Ignores any inline schema, infers schema from the data and loads the data. If the already contains a schema, the current schema is extended by adding new tables or adding columns to existing tables. An exception is thrown if the inferred table already exists but with a different namespace, or if any of the inferred columns conflict with existing columns.

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlReadMode.InferTypedSchema
member.summary: Ignores any inline schema, infers a strongly typed schema from the data, and loads the data. If the type cannot be inferred from the data, it is interpreted as string data. If the already contains a schema, the current schema is extended, either by adding new tables or by adding columns to existing tables. An exception is thrown if the inferred table already exists but with a different namespace, or if any of the inferred columns conflict with existing columns.

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlReadMode.ReadSchema
member.summary: Reads any inline schema and loads the data. If the already contains schema, new tables may be added to the schema, but an exception is thrown if any tables in the inline schema already exist in the .

member.name: T:System.Data.XmlWriteMode
member.summary: Specifies how to write XML data and a relational schema from a .

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlWriteMode.DiffGram
member.summary: Writes the entire as a DiffGram, including original and current values. To generate a DiffGram containing only changed values, call , and then call as a DiffGram on the returned .

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlWriteMode.IgnoreSchema
member.summary: Writes the current contents of the as XML data, without an XSD schema. If no data is loaded into the , nothing is written.

member.name: F:System.Data.XmlWriteMode.WriteSchema
member.summary: Writes the current contents of the as XML data with the relational structure as inline XSD schema. If the has only a schema with no data, only the inline schema is written. If the does not have a current schema, nothing is written.

member.name: T:System.Data.Common.GroupByBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the relationship between the columns in a GROUP BY clause and the non-aggregated columns in the select-list of a SELECT statement.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.GroupByBehavior.ExactMatch
member.summary: The GROUP BY clause must contain all nonaggregated columns in the select list, and must not contain other columns not in the select list.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.GroupByBehavior.MustContainAll
member.summary: The GROUP BY clause must contain all nonaggregated columns in the select list, and can contain other columns not in the select list.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.GroupByBehavior.NotSupported
member.summary: The GROUP BY clause is not supported.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.GroupByBehavior.Unknown
member.summary: The support for the GROUP BY clause is unknown.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.GroupByBehavior.Unrelated
member.summary: There is no relationship between the columns in the GROUP BY clause and the nonaggregated columns in the SELECT list. You may group by any column.

member.name: T:System.Data.Common.IdentifierCase
member.summary: Specifies how identifiers are treated by the data source when searching the system catalog.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.IdentifierCase.Insensitive
member.summary: The data source ignores identifier case when searching the system catalog. The identifiers "ab" and "AB" will match.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.IdentifierCase.Sensitive
member.summary: The data source distinguishes identifier case when searching the system catalog. The identifiers "ab" and "AB" will not match.

member.name: F:System.Data.Common.IdentifierCase.Unknown
member.summary: The data source has ambiguous rules regarding identifier case and cannot discern this information.

member.summary: The character that separates the catalog name from the rest of the identifier in a text command. Maps to DBLITERAL_CATALOG_SEPARATOR.

member.summary: A character literal in a text command. Maps to DBLITERAL_CHAR_LITERAL.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Column_Alias
member.summary: A column alias in a text command. Maps to DBLITERAL_COLUMN_ALIAS.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Column_Name
member.summary: A column name used in a text command or in a data-definition interface. Maps to DBLITERAL_COLUMN_NAME.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Correlation_Name
member.summary: A correlation name (table alias) in a text command. Maps to DBLITERAL_CORRELATION_NAME.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Cube_Name
member.summary: The name of a cube in a schema (or the catalog if the provider does not support schemas).

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Cursor_Name
member.summary: A cursor name in a text command. Maps to DBLITERAL_CURSOR_NAME.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Dimension_Name
member.summary: The name of the dimension. If a dimension is part of more than one cube, there is one row for each cube/dimension combination.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Escape_Percent_Prefix
member.summary: The character used in a LIKE clause to escape the character returned for the DBLITERAL_LIKE_PERCENT literal. For example, if a percent sign (%) is used to match zero or more characters and this is a backslash (\), the characters "abc\%%" match all character values that start with "abc%". Some SQL dialects support a clause (the ESCAPE clause) that can be used to override this value. Maps to DBLITERAL_ESCAPE_PERCENT_PREFIX.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Escape_Percent_Suffix
member.summary: The escape character, if any, used to suffix the character returned for the DBLITERAL_LIKE_PERCENT literal. For example, if a percent sign (%) is used to match zero or more characters and percent signs are escaped by enclosing in open and close square brackets, DBLITERAL_ESCAPE_PERCENT_PREFIX is "[", DBLITERAL_ESCAPE_PERCENT_SUFFIX is "]", and the characters "abc[%]%" match all character values that start with "abc%". Providers that do not use a suffix character to escape the DBLITERAL_ESCAPE_PERCENT character do not return this literal value and can set the lt member of the DBLITERAL structure to DBLITERAL_INVALID if requested. Maps to DBLITERAL_ESCAPE_PERCENT_SUFFIX.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Escape_Underscore_Prefix
member.summary: The character used in a LIKE clause to escape the character returned for the DBLITERAL_LIKE_UNDERSCORE literal. For example, if an underscore (_) is used to match exactly one character and this is a backslash (\), the characters "abc\_ _" match all character values that are five characters long and start with "abc_". Some SQL dialects support a clause (the ESCAPE clause) that can be used to override this value. Maps to DBLITERAL_ESCAPE_UNDERSCORE_PREFIX.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Escape_Underscore_Suffix
member.summary: The character used in a LIKE clause to escape the character returned for the DBLITERAL_LIKE_UNDERSCORE literal. For example, if an underscore (_) is used to match exactly one character and this is a backslash (\), the characters "abc\_ _" match all character values that are five characters long and start with "abc_". Some SQL dialects support a clause (the ESCAPE clause) that can be used to override this value. Maps to DBLITERAL_ESCAPE_UNDERSCORE_SUFFIX.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Hierarchy_Name
member.summary: The name of the hierarchy. If the dimension does not contain a hierarchy or has only one hierarchy, the current column contains a null value.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Index_Name
member.summary: An index name used in a text command or in a data-definition interface. Maps to DBLITERAL_INDEX_NAME.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Invalid
member.summary: An invalid value. Maps to DBLITERAL_INVALID.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Level_Name
member.summary: Name of the cube to which the current level belongs.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Like_Percent
member.summary: The character used in a LIKE clause to match zero or more characters. For example, if this is a percent sign (%), the characters "abc%" match all character values that start with "abc". Maps to DBLITERAL_LIKE_PERCENT.

member.name: F:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbLiteral.Like_Underscore
member.summary: The character used in a LIKE clause to match exactly one character. For example, if this is an underscore (_), the characters "abc_" match all character values that are four characters long and start with "abc". Maps to DBLITERAL_LIKE_UNDERSCORE.

A string that contains the Service Broker service name where notification messages are posted, and it must include a database name or a Service Broker instance GUID that restricts the scope of the service name lookup to a particular database.For more information about the format of the options parameter, see .

A string that contains an application-specific identifier for this notification. It is not used by the notifications infrastructure, but it allows you to associate notifications with the application state. The value indicated in this parameter is included in the Service Broker queue message.

No conversions are made for the current version of ADO.NET.LatestUse the latest version than this client-server pair can handle. This will automatically move forward as the client and server components are upgraded.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo
member.summary: This enumeration provides additional information about the different notifications that can be received by the dependency event handler.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.AlreadyChanged
member.summary: The SqlDependency object already fired, and new commands cannot be added to it.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Alter
member.summary: An underlying server object related to the query was modified.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Delete
member.summary: Data was changed by a DELETE statement.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Drop
member.summary: An underlying object related to the query was dropped.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Error
member.summary: An internal server error occurred.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Expired
member.summary: The SqlDependency object has expired.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Insert
member.summary: Data was changed by an INSERT statement.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Invalid
member.summary: A statement was provided that cannot be notified (for example, an UPDATE statement).

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Isolation
member.summary: The statement was executed under an isolation mode that was not valid (for example, Snapshot).

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Options
member.summary: The SET options were not set appropriately at subscription time.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.PreviousFire
member.summary: A previous statement has caused query notifications to fire under the current transaction.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Query
member.summary: A SELECT statement that cannot be notified or was provided.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Resource
member.summary: Fires as a result of server resource pressure.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Restart
member.summary: The server was restarted (notifications are sent during restart.).

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.TemplateLimit
member.summary: The subscribing query causes the number of templates on one of the target tables to exceed the maximum allowable limit.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Truncate
member.summary: One or more tables were truncated.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Unknown
member.summary: Used when the info option sent by the server was not recognized by the client.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationInfo.Update
member.summary: Data was changed by an UPDATE statement.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource
member.summary: Indicates the source of the notification received by the dependency event handler.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Client
member.summary: A client-initiated notification occurred, such as a client-side time-out or as a result of attempting to add a command to a dependency that has already fired.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Data
member.summary: Data has changed; for example, an insert, update, delete, or truncate operation occurred.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Database
member.summary: The database state changed; for example, the database related to the query was dropped or detached.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Environment
member.summary: The run-time environment was not compatible with notifications; for example, the isolation level was set to snapshot, or one or more SET options are not compatible.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Execution
member.summary: A run-time error occurred during execution.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Object
member.summary: A database object changed; for example, an underlying object related to the query was dropped or modified.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Owner
member.summary: Internal only; not intended to be used in your code.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Statement
member.summary: The Transact-SQL statement is not valid for notifications; for example, a SELECT statement that could not be notified or a non-SELECT statement was executed.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.System
member.summary: A system-related event occurred. For example, there was an internal error, the server was restarted, or resource pressure caused the invalidation.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Timeout
member.summary: The subscription time-out expired.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationSource.Unknown
member.summary: Used when the source option sent by the server was not recognized by the client.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType
member.summary: Describes the different notification types that can be received by an event handler through the parameter.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType.Change
member.summary: Data on the server being monitored changed. Use the item to determine the details of the change.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType.Subscribe
member.summary: There was a failure to create a notification subscription. Use the object's item to determine the cause of the failure.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlNotificationType.Unknown
member.summary: Used when the type option sent by the server was not recognized by the client.

member.name: N:System.Data.SqlTypes
member.summary: The namespace provides classes for native data types within SQL Server 2005. These classes provide a safer, faster alternative to the data types provided by the .NET Framework common language runtime (CLR). Using the classes in this namespace helps prevent type conversion errors caused by loss of precision. Because other data types are converted to and from SqlTypes behind the scenes, explicitly creating and using objects within this namespace also yields faster code.

member.summary: Specifies the compare option values for a structure.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions.BinarySort
member.summary: Specifies that sorts should be based on a characters numeric value instead of its alphabetical value.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions.BinarySort2
member.summary: Performs a binary sort.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Specifies that comparisons must ignore case.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions.IgnoreKanaType
member.summary: Specifies that comparisons must ignore the Kana type. Kana type refers to Japanese hiragana and katakana characters that represent phonetic sounds in the Japanese language. Hiragana is used for native Japanese expressions and words, while katakana is used for words borrowed from other languages, such as "computer" or "Internet". A phonetic sound can be expressed in both hiragana and katakana. If this value is selected, the hiragana character for one sound is considered equal to the katakana character for the same sound.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions.IgnoreNonSpace
member.summary: Specifies that comparisons must ignore nonspace combining characters, such as diacritics. The Unicode Standard defines combining characters as characters that are combined with base characters to produce a new character. Non-space combining characters do not use character space by themselves when rendered. For more information about non-space combining characters, see the Unicode Standard at http://www.unicode.org.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions.IgnoreWidth
member.summary: Specifies that comparisons must ignore the character width. For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width and, if this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written in half-width.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlCompareOptions.None
member.summary: Specifies the default option settings for comparisons.

member.name: T:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlDateTime
member.summary: Represents the date and time data ranging in value from January 1, 1753 to December 31, 9999 to an accuracy of 3.33 milliseconds to be stored in or retrieved from a database. The structure has a different underlying data structure from its corresponding .NET Framework type, , which can represent any time between 12:00:00 AM 1/1/0001 and 11:59:59 PM 12/31/9999, to the accuracy of 100 nanoseconds. actually stores the relative difference to 00:00:00 AM 1/1/1900. Therefore, a conversion from "00:00:00 AM 1/1/1900" to an integer will return 0.

member.summary: Represents a variable-length stream of characters to be stored in or retrieved from the database. has a different underlying data structure from its corresponding .NET Framework data type. always uses the default from the current thread, but contains its own locale Id and compare flags. member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Specifies that comparisons should ignore case.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreKanaType
member.summary: Specifies that the string comparison must ignore the Kana type. Kana type refers to Japanese hiragana and katakana characters that represent phonetic sounds in the Japanese language. Hiragana is used for native Japanese expressions and words, while katakana is used for words borrowed from other languages, such as "computer" or "Internet". A phonetic sound can be expressed in both hiragana and katakana. If this value is selected, the hiragana character for one sound is considered equal to the katakana character for the same sound.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreNonSpace
member.summary: Specifies that the string comparison must ignore non-space combining characters, such as diacritics. The Unicode Standard defines combining characters as characters that are combined with base characters to produce a new character. Non-space combining characters do not use character space by themselves when rendered. For more information about non-space combining characters, see the Unicode Standard at http://www.unicode.org.

member.name: F:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlString.IgnoreWidth
member.summary: Specifies that the string comparison must ignore the character width. For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width and, if this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written in half-width.
